name: MOST DOUBTFUL BLACK
description:

Your Own Luck
Little By Little

By The Way
It´s All Good

name: X
description:
X (2008)

Collector´s Edition
Liner notes for each song
Budda Cakes Promotional Flyer from 2008
Signed and Individually Numbered
CD

Songs:

Turn It Up
Crystal In A Shadow
June
I'm Not Listening
However
Full Stop First Step
Which Side Are You On
The Sex Has Made Me Stupid
Evicted

*** IF YOU DONT HAVE A PAYPAL ACCOUNT SEND AN EMAIL WITH YOUR ORDER TO buddacakes@yahoo.co.uk***


"This music, for me, has a certain indescribable magic or charm that is lacking in so much music that I hear.
The lyrics are clever, the vocals, rich and textural, the accordian...sounds cool again (did it ever?)...and it definitely has some lovely british swank going for it. "
CAVEDOLL

"The Budda Cakes make me happy, make me smile, make me wanna go tell the world about their alternative take on modern music. The Budda Cakes are just such a pleasure to partake of - their music is refreshingly strange, their sound is delightfully unusual, their lyrics are so beautifully 'normal'. Yep, I like The Budda Cakes muchly!!
'X' is The Budda Cakes' new album - a pretty stunning work that can sound glib and tongue in cheek yet it's amazingly original and thoroughly enjoyable. Just a three-piece maybe but with their armoury of instruments and accessories that most bands would leave in the second-hand shop, The Budda Cakes make a wonderfully intoxicating 'noise', they sound as if they really enjoy themselves and their enthusiasm is contagious.

The Budda Cakes make great music, they refuse to be pigeonholed, they challenge musical normality and I love everything they do!!" TOXIC PETE

"Fractious and haphazard as a raging manic-depressive, “X” exudes a quirky sense of mystery from beginning to end. Loaded with frantic references to Central London and accompanied by a flurry of accordion-like harmonium notes....
Resting somewhere between giddiness and raving insanity, “X” is by turns both an irrepressibly hyperactive and eerily tender slice of experimentalism."
Faye Coulman / GLASSWERK

name: The Budda Cakes EP
description:
THE BUDDA CAKES EP
2006

Tracks:

1.) Unnecessary
2.) In My Arms
3.) Always
4.) Erections
5.) Silence

Hand-Drawn Bone Bear Artwork by Gordon Naspick
Signed and Individually Numbered
Collector´s Item

*** IF YOU DONT HAVE A PAYPAL ACCOUNT SEND AN EMAIL WITH YOUR ORDER TO buddacakes@yahoo.co.uk***

"This debut EP has to be one of the most unusual pieces of work I've come across recently. The Budda Cakes EP is a brilliant piece of work. I admire these guys for having the guts to lay down such a varied exhibition of contemporary music ... as inventive and as fresh as it gets. Superb!!"
Peter Brown / TOXICPETE

"The Budda Cakes release their debut EP and what an eclectic mix it is. Apparently recording their album by candlelight to capture an essence like no other album has done, The Budda Cakes have made sure this certainly shines through in their music... The Budda Cakes are quite unique from everybody else.
Nat Geraghty / GLASSWERK

"The debut three track release from London three piece The Budda Cakes combines more creative artistry and freewheeling melodic depth than a fair few bands currently receiving accolades and plaudits. They appear to have an uncanny knack at shitting tunes at will...each of these five tunes reveal a different facet of the ensembles creativity."
Mark Barton /LOSING TODAY

...they ARE brilliant! Thank god for that. Marvellous...It's been quite a trip by the time the last note rings out, and one which is going to keep you interested for ages. Until it pops into existence, we can only predict the madness that would come with a full length album.
LEEDS MUSICSCENE

Their sound is definitely unique. Its impossible find any comparisons. Christine Trower / MUSIC 4M
